candidates.description:
Huey Long is a Senator from Louisiana, who served as the governor before winning his Senate seat. Surviving an assassination attempt in 1935, he narrowly secured the Democratic Nomination for this election after Roosevelt's death and Garner's refusal to seek a full term. A tense and confused convention, still reeling from the loss of such an iconic figurehead, choose to nominate the controversial but upstart candidate that is Huey Long.

Long promises to reform the very popular New Deal policies, arguing Roosevelt has not gone far enough, in what he calls the 'Share Our Wealth' programs. If passed, these programs could radically transform the economy. To win, Long can either reconcile with the party establishment, or go all in on his Share Our Wealth programs. Long must also defend his record as Governor of Louisiana, and be careful that the skeletons don't come creeping out of the closet...

Alf Landon is the current governor of Kansas. He is a member of the liberal wing of the Republican Party, and had been chosen by the Republican Party Machinery for this exact reason. Due to the sheer unpopularity of the Republican Party, it will be tricky for Landon to turn this election around, as even with the divided Democratic Party, Huey Long is still favored to win the election.

Landon will have to pledge to continue New Deal policies, and convince the electorate that he is the safer and more moderate choice than Long.

Charles McNary is one of the leading members of the Republican Party’s progressive wing, and has served as Senate Minority Leader ever since Democrats won back control of the chamber in 1932.

McNary is from Oregon, a state which you might have a shot at winning if you play your cards right. It may take a lot of effort to convince him to join your ticket, but it may very well be worth it.

Burton Wheeler, a Senator from Montana, is probably the only person even willing to be on the ticket with you right now. He was a strong supporter of President Roosevelt, and has pretty bluntly opposed Garner's administration.

Wheeler will likely help you within the farm states, which is definitely good news for you since you're somewhat lacking on agricultural issues. Overall, Wheeler is a decent choice to be your running mate, and will help you attempt to unite the party under Roosevelt's legacy.

questions.description: After a long night of politicking in your home state of Louisiana, you see a man approach you. He's got glasses but you don't seem to recognize him. What will you do?

answers.description: I need my guards to stay alert. There's already lots of people out to get me.
answers.feedback: Turns out you caught your would-be assassin. Phew, that was close.

answers.description: Guards? Who is this man? I want him detained for trespassing.
answers.feedback: Turns out you caught your would-be assassin. Phew, that was close.

answers.description: I always love to meet with the working people. Let him come over, and we can have a friendly discussion.
answers.feedback: Your smile quickly turns into a shock, as you are shot by Carl Weiss and die a bit over a day afterwards.

questions.description: What will you say about the nomination of Burton Wheeler as your running mate?

answers.description: Wheeler is an incredibly intelligent and hard-working Senator. I believe he will assist us in our quest to make Every Man a King!
answers.feedback: Wheeler is a safe and popular choice with convention goers.

questions.description: Historically, you have continued to hold massive sway over local politics in Louisiana. Will this behavior continue if elected to the White House?

answers.description: I've had no choice but to engage myself in the politics down at my home in order to protect the policies I have enacted. I will continue to defend my record no matter what.
answers.feedback: Many see your behavior in this regard as odd.

answers.description: This sort of behavior may alienate voters. We should try to maintain a more professional image, while still strongarming opponents in Washington whenever possible.
answers.feedback: This is probably for the best, all things considered.

questions.description: What will your main campaign theme be?

answers.description: I’ve implemented popular reforms in Louisiana that have fought against the Great Depression, and I’m gonna bring them to the rest of America. Plain and simple.
answers.feedback: This will help you with farmers and southerners who want more federal action to combat the Depression. Just remember that many Democrats in the east, especially key states like New York, are a bit more conservative.

answers.description: We should have my surrogates press my foreign policy expertise. I pledge to not get us entangled with foreign affairs.
answers.feedback: This is a good speech, but there was probably more to be said.

answers.description: Republicans are blasted socialist! Plain and simple! We must defeat them in November.
answers.feedback: Huh?

answers.description: Republicans got us into this depression - and you really trust them to get us out of this? Huey Long for President.
answers.feedback: This is a great way to unite the party while going against the Republicans’ unpopular policies.

questions.description: Share Our Wealth is heavily tied to your name, and it’s something you campaigned on in the primaries. Are you looking to continue campaigning on it in the general election?

answers.description: Our best route is to market it as our expansion of the New Deal, but my hardcore supporters will understand that Share Our Wealth is still around.
answers.feedback: You are missing a big opportunity to point to your successes in Louisiana.

answers.description: I will never stop talking about the fact we need to end the Great Depression and get America back on track.
answers.feedback: Pointing to your successes in Louisiana is not a bad idea. But be careful here.

answers.description: Considering our steady, yet fragile lead, let’s not rock the boat too hard. I’m sure my policies will be popular once implemented.
answers.feedback: Your advisors believe that you are missing an opportunity. However, this strategy will keep you from alienating any voting group in particular.

answers.description: I’ll promise to continue our New Deal policies with some improvements. That is really what Share Our Wealth is about.
answers.feedback: Your greatest strength, and perhaps your only one is your desire for change. You aren’t really helping yourself.

questions.description: Alf Landon, who is the Republican nominee, appears to be an ineffective campaigner. To what extent will you take advantage of this?

answers.description: I will attack Landon for this. If he can’t even properly go out and give speeches, how can we expect him to lead the nation?
answers.feedback: This is a solid attack, pointing our Landon’s weakness and highlighting your strengths.

answers.description: I will attack Landon in clever ways, such as joking that the Missing Persons Bureau is looking for him due to the fact he rarely even campaigns!
answers.feedback: A good chunk of Americans aren’t enthused by Landon, and these attacks emphasize this.

answers.description: Let’s not focus on Alf Landon too much, instead we should campaign safely and avoid damaging our lead.
answers.feedback: Your advisors believe you’re leaving good opportunities on the table.

questions.description: Radio advertisements were very effective for Roosevelt in 1932. To what extent will you use them?

answers.description: I’ll implement a similar strategy to Roosevelt’s Fireside Chats. If I can get the opportunity to simply talk to the American people, it’ll be a winning strategy.
answers.feedback: In addition to being a great speaker, you are also able to reach millions of Americans over the radio. This will be of great help to your cause.

answers.description: Let’s use them from time to time, giving advertisements about our policies and the like.
answers.feedback: Many great Democratic speakers make your case to the American public via radio. This should help your poll numbers.

answers.description: I’m not sure Radio usage will help me as much this time around. I work best with long speeches across the country.
answers.feedback: More and more Americans are buying household radios. Your advisors are disappointed, and believe you have missed an opportunity, especially as it worked well for Roosevelt 4 years ago.

questions.description: The climate in Europe is darkening, with Adolf Hitler and Benito Mussolini taking power in Germany and Italy, and Italian forces closing in on conquering Ethiopia. Do you have any comments?

answers.description: Germany and Italy better stop their disrespect for other countries' borders. I will impose sanctions on these two nations, and leave it at that.
answers.feedback: This is a good answer that strikes a balance between non-intervention and disavowing these nations.

answers.description: Let’s pledge neutrality and hope that the powers of Europe can come to an agreement. This has always been the safe stance.
answers.feedback: It wouldn’t have hurt to have been more firm against Germany/Italy.

answers.description: I think the changes we've seen in the world, in terms of politics, have been based- cough -based upon a strong desire for change from the old capitalist system.
answers.feedback: Some of your supporters indeed look up to these new despots as a source of stability in a rapidly changing world. But people are concerned about their aggressive nature.

answers.description: We don’t plan to address foreign policy, except disavowing extremism wherever we meet it.
answers.feedback: Germany is very unpopular in the states, you could’ve done more to disavow them.

questions.description: As President, what will your policies on race and Civil Rights be?

answers.description: I fully support a civil rights bill. Although we freed the slaves almost a century ago, their children and grandchildren still live under oppression due to racist laws. One of my priorities is to help the disadvantaged among us.
answers.feedback: You got the right mindset, but as expected, the Southern Democrats are mad. They splinter into a third party and nominate Harry F. Byrd, vowing to keep the racist policies you wish to repeal. Hopefully you can win without those states.

answers.description: While I won't make race a part of my campaign, I will make subtle improvements but in ways that won’t upset the South.
answers.feedback: Civil rights are not a big issue this election, so this is not a bad choice.

answers.description: Under no circumstances would I support the advance of civil rights.
answers.feedback: This is not a surprising answer from a Democrat. However, there are many black and progressive voters in the north who don’t like this answer.

questions.description: What is your stance on trade?

answers.description: I support Tariff increases. We need to protect American businesses during times like these.
answers.feedback: High tariffs are not popular within the Democratic party. In addition, foreign nations retaliated against these tariffs with counter-tariffs of their own. Most voters are not happy with the economic situation caused by these tariffs.

answers.description: While I believe protectionism is important, I fear these tariffs are way too high and should be decreased.
answers.feedback: Although promising to cut tariffs is a good idea, many Democrats raise their eyebrows when you say that protectionism is important.

answers.description: I’m glad the Smoot-Hawley Tariff Act was repealed, it was making the Depression worse. We need to open up markets for American businesses.
answers.feedback: This statement brings cheers from all corners of the party. Foreign nations retaliated against these tariffs with counter-tariffs of their own, and most voters are not happy with the economic situation caused by these tariffs.

answers.description: I’d say I am okay with trade, and support our current system.
answers.feedback: A response that will help you in some areas but hurt you in others.

questions.description: Let’s talk a bit about your own policies. Your 'Share Our Wealth' program includes a cap on personal fortunes at $100 Million USD, and an annual income cap at $1 Million USD. What are your thoughts on this?

answers.description: In retrospect, this is a horrible idea. During a depression, we should encourage spending.
answers.feedback: While not all of your programs have total public support, quite a few see some conservatism in this answer.

answers.description: I think this is a bit too much, I shall modify the limits a bit to appeal to moderates
answers.feedback: This may be a good option, still keeping to the general idea, but adjusting it to improve support.

answers.description: Frankly, these rates are a compromise, and I’ll set the rates even higher if I had more congressional support.
answers.feedback: Pledging to raise taxes farther is not a good idea.

answers.description: These rules are good, will give the government the funds to help the American people, and prevent the wealthy from becoming too powerful
answers.feedback: Although some progressives are happy, the idea of these taxes are widely unpopular.

questions.description: Earlier today, it was revealed to the press that a federal investigation into voter fraud during your election in 1932 is underway. Do you have a response to this?

answers.description: I can assure you all, the facts will be laid out, and I will be proven innocent and the rightfully elected candidate serving.
answers.feedback: This is probably the safest response, but you will be hurt nonetheless.

answers.description: I think it’s best if I keep quiet about this. We will cooperate if asked to testify during the investigation.
answers.feedback: Your silence seems to tell the press a lot, but some feel you're doing the most formal thing. You are running for President, however.

questions.description: Do you plan on extensive personal campaigning in public?

answers.description: My best quality is my speaking skills, I can fire up crowds across the nation. Of course I will.
answers.feedback: While on the campaign trail, there is yet another assassination attempt on you. However, you seem mostly uninjured. You’ll be hospitalized for a bit, so you lose some ground on the trail.

answers.description: My best quality is my speaking skills, I can fire up crowds across the nation. Of course I will.
answers.feedback: You are generally thought to be a very good and captivating public speaker, which will help you in the polls.

answers.description: My best quality is my speaking skills, I can fire up crowds across the nation. Of course I will.
answers.feedback: While campaigning, you are tragically shot. The Democratic party scrambles to get Burton Wheeler on the ballot in your place, and nominates Henry Wallace as his running mate.

answers.description: I’ve only narrowly survived an assassination attempt before. I’m going to be out giving speeches but for my own security I am not going overboard.
answers.feedback: Your advisors believe you're missing an opportunity here.

questions.description: Considering the current rate of deflation of the American dollar, would you consider leaving the gold standard as president?

answers.description: Yes, I believe that abolishing the federal gold standard will help to solve our current deflation problem.
answers.feedback: This will help you a bit among the Progressives in the party.

answers.description: No, the gold standard is an important backing of our currency. There are better ways to deal with our deflation problem.

questions.description: Another day, another rally. What are you looking to address today?

answers.description: Let’s keep a positive campaign, no more attacks. I believe the American People are tired of them.
answers.feedback: This is fine with most voters, as they want solutions to the economic depression.

answers.description: Electing Alf Landon, a fool and newcomer, is a risk we cannot take in a dangerous world.
answers.feedback: Landon retaliates these attacks as the race seems to be escalating.

answers.description: I will remind voters I have new and grand solutions to the Great Depression, and Alf Landon is part of the same party that led us into this mess.
answers.feedback: This strikes a good balance.

questions.description: Foreign Policy is growing ever more important in the long run with what's going on in Europe. However, in general, what would a Long Administration’s foreign policy look like?

answers.description: We’re mostly gonna keep Roosevelt's current policies. Maybe a bit less intervention.
answers.feedback: Foreign policy is not really a big issue this election. No harm, no foul.

answers.description: We need to be more involved on the world stage to ensure peace. Perhaps joining the League of Nations is a good idea.
answers.feedback: Americans at large are more isolationist right now.

answers.description: Let’s not really address foreign policy, besides promising to keep our current vision of the Monroe Doctrine.
answers.feedback: This seems a touch too globalist for most voters, but it could help in some areas.

answers.description: Over the last few years, we were too entangled in foreign affairs. Foreign aid was crippling our debt and we are guided by Wall Street and Standard Oil in our foreign decision making.
answers.feedback: This is probably the majority view right now. Americans want to focus on America First and aren’t interested in occupying nations in Central America.

questions.description: Looks like another scandal broke out. The New York Times is reporting that you essentially kidnapped a man named Sam Irby who was prepared to speak out against your administration during your Senate campaign. Any thoughts?

answers.description: Damn you Irby!
answers.feedback: Be prepared for your poll numbers to take a hit.

answers.description: I will bluntly profess my innocence here, and promise that his testimony that he was not kidnapped at the time is sincere.
answers.feedback: Be prepared for your poll numbers to take a hit.

questions.description: Yet again, another scandal seems to have shown up. The Chicago Daily Tribune catches a detailed scoop on your use of state jobs to maintain your political power, and compare it to Tammany Hall in New York. How will your campaign respond to this?

answers.description: Write to any paper willing to talk with us - these accusations are baseless. I have always respected the institution of public office.
answers.feedback: A strong response, but you will nevertheless be damaged by this.

answers.description: We will ignore the press and continue the campaign as usual. Anything we may say could easily backfire.
answers.feedback: Any attempt to run away from this only draws up more suspicion.

questions.description: Do you support granting independence to the Philippines? What about other United States colonies?

answers.description: It's quite hypocritical for a state founded on independence from a faraway power to continue to possess colonies. I believe the Philippines, along with Alaska and Hawaii deserve their independence.
I am very glad to hear that we are on track to grant the Philippines their independence within the next 20 years. If we can shorten the timeline, I would support that.
answers.feedback: Americans generally support letting the Philippines determine their own - as of late.

answers.description: It's dangerous to give up such important strategic areas in a more hostile world. I think we should hold onto them until there is a more peaceful situation.
answers.feedback: A fair point is to be made here.

questions.description: Yet again, another scandal of yours has hit the papers. The New York Herald Tribune reports that you told George Sokolsky that you're '...Mussolini and Hitler rolled into one. Mussolini force-fed dissidents castor oil; I’ll give them Tabasco, and then they’ll like Louisiana.' Do you have any response?

answers.description: Sokolsky is blatantly lying in an attempt to save such a failing newspaper. I said no such thing.
answers.feedback: This is the best response, but you're going to be hurt no matter what.

answers.description: On a certain level, you have to respect how quickly these countries have rebuilt their strength. Obviously, we need to have proper democracy, but there's nothing wrong with a strong leader.
answers.feedback: Some are tuned into the rhetoric of these two leaders, but many Americans feel uneasy about how rapidly the two nations have dismantled their democratic institutions.

questions.description: What is your current policy towards farmers and subsidies?

answers.description: Subsidies have seemed to make the situation worse. Removing these regulations will allow the market to improve.
answers.feedback: Farmers are not really happy about this statement.

answers.description: Our current subsidies are important for helping farmers across the nation. They’re the ones that feed everyone here, and we ought to help them.
answers.feedback: This is the kind of answer that many in the west want to hear.

answers.description: We intend on keeping the subsidies, but we shall keep quiet about it to not alienate conservatives.
answers.feedback: A safe move, but it doesn't do much to change the polling.

questions.description: Seriously? The New York Times reported earlier today that you've been co-owning a oil company, called Win or Lose Oil Company, and using your position as Governor to grant them land rights. How will you respond?

answers.description: What?! I had no part in this! Find me the reported that made such a claim!
answers.feedback: It's pretty clear you did exactly what the paper alleged. While not illegal, your populist image is seriously damaged.

questions.description: Another day, another rally. What are you looking to address today?

answers.description: I will remind voters I have new and grand solutions to the Great Depression, and Alf Landon is part of the same party that led us into this mess.
answers.feedback: Perfect response.

answers.description: Let’s keep a positive campaign, no more attacks. I believe the American People are tired of them.
answers.feedback: This answer is safely moderate.

answers.description: Electing Alf Landon, a fool and newcomer, is a risk we cannot take in a dangerous world.
answers.feedback: Landon retaliates these attacks as the race seems to be escalating.

questions.description: Election Day is tomorrow. Any last things you wish to focus on?

answers.description: No, I trust that Americans will see who the better candidate is. Any last minute statements could backfire on us, which is the last thing we need.
answers.feedback: This is a safe strategy if you have built up a good lead. But you probably haven't.

answers.description: We will implement Share Our Wealth! Every man is a king, but no one wears a crown!
answers.feedback: This is an expected topic for a final speech.

answers.description: I will give a very general speech that addresses how I plan to achieve prosperity with Share Our Wealth.
answers.feedback: Alright. Way to get that crowd fired up.

answers.description: Our last effort will be an attack on Alf Landon. Remember where Republican policies got us? The Great Depression.
answers.feedback: Not a bad point to hit Landon on, especially since the Republicans’ economic policies are loathed.

questions.description: Where will you spend the final day of your campaign?

answers.description: Illinois, with some time in Iowa too. These are crucial states we must hold.
answers.feedback: Best of luck tomorrow.

answers.description: New York is a heavy prize in the Electoral College. We can’t afford to let Alf Landon pick up those 47 Electoral Votes.
answers.feedback: Best of luck tomorrow.

answers.description: I will hold rallies in Pennsylvania and New Jersey. I bet I could win Pennsylvania, which Roosevelt was unable to do.
The midwest is a crucial area. I will make spend the day making stops in Ohio, Michigan, and Indiana.
answers.feedback: Best of luck tomorrow.

questions.description: Which of the Republican Primary states do you wish to contest the most?

answers.description: We will put funds into Illinois, a key state we must be victorious in come November.
answers.feedback: A rather large state will need plenty of attention early.

answers.description: We will put funds in trying to win Pennsylvania. We can secure many loyal delegates here.
answers.feedback: You lose Pennsylvania, but party leaders easily back you at the convention.

answers.description: We will put funds in California, since we may not be able to travel there as much come the fall.
answers.feedback: Favorite Son Earl Warren carries the state easily. You still secure the nomination due to party backing.

questions.description: After the death of Roosevelt due to a stroke in 1935, a divided Democratic Party nominated Huey Long on the 30th ballot. What do you have to say about his candidacy.

answers.description: I congratulate him on his victory, but rest assured we have confidence it will be his last one.
answers.feedback: An enthusiastic and comedic response sets a friendly tone for you.

questions.description: You're a young, energetic, moderate Governor of a state Roosevelt won in a sweep 4 years ago. How will you press your record as Governor of Kansas?

answers.description: As Governor, I have supported many aspects of the New Deal. I pledge as President to continue the recovery I have helped lead in Kansas on a national level.
answers.feedback: A solid response.

answers.description: We will shore up some conservative support here. We'll talk about how I sought to reduce taxes and balance the budget. It's best that we ensure party unity going into the election.
answers.feedback: This is probably for the best, all things considered.

questions.description: What will your main campaign theme be?

answers.description: I’ve implemented popular reforms in Kansas that have fought against the Great Depression. We will put money back in the hands of working people.
answers.feedback: This will help you with farmers who want more federal action to combat the Depression.

answers.description: We should have my surrogates press my foreign policy expertise. I pledge to not get us entangled with foreign affairs.
answers.feedback: This is a good speech, but there was probably more to be said.

answers.description: Huey Long has been nothing but a demagogue who has ruled Louisiana with an iron fist.
answers.feedback: A very strong attack here, and one that you should hammer on.

answers.description: Radical policies on both sides got us into this mess. I am the people's choice to lead us out of this depression.
answers.feedback: This is a great way to unite the party, and perhaps the nation.

questions.description: Huey Long will not stop talking about this so-called 'Share Our Wealth'. What do you have to say about it?

answers.description: Let's cut into his support by pressing the claim my policies more align with the New Deal.
answers.feedback: An interesting route of attack here.

answers.description: We need to go on the offense here. This 'Share Our Wealth' will make us an awfully lot like the Soviet Union if enacted.
answers.feedback: It's good to hit hard on this.

answers.description: We need to go on the offense here. This 'Share Our Wealth' will make us an awfully lot like Germany if enacted.
answers.feedback: It's good to hit hard on this.

questions.description: So far, you appear to be an ineffective campaigner. What steps will you take to lessen the damage of this?

answers.description: I will go on an aggressive tour of the country, which will increase my national image and name recognition.
answers.feedback: This tour goes over pretty well, as crowds gather to see you.

answers.description: We can distract from this by pressing the concerns over Long's tenure as Governor of Louisiana. He is nothing short of a demagogue.
answers.feedback: Long has plenty of routes to attack him on. Don't be afraid of not holding back.

questions.description: Radio advertisements were very effective for Roosevelt in 1932. To what extent will you use them?

answers.description: I’ll implement a similar strategy to Roosevelt’s Fireside Chats. If I can get the opportunity to simply talk to the American people, it’ll be a winning strategy.
answers.feedback: In addition to being a great speaker, you are also able to reach millions of Americans over the radio. This will be of great help to your cause.

answers.description: Let’s use them from time to time, giving advertisements about our policies and the like.
answers.feedback: Many great speakers make your case to the American public via radio. This should help your poll numbers.

answers.description: I’m not sure Radio usage will help me as much this time around. I work best with long speeches across the country.
answers.feedback: More and more Americans are buying household radios. Your advisors are disappointed, and believe you have missed an opportunity, especially as it worked well for Roosevelt 4 years ago.

questions.description: The climate in Europe is darkening, with Adolf Hitler and Benito Mussolini taking power in Germany and Italy, and Italian forces closing in on conquering Ethiopia. Do you have any comments?

answers.description: Germany and Italy better stop their disrespect for other countries' borders. I will impose sanctions on these two nations, and leave it at that.
answers.feedback: This is a good answer that strikes a balance between non-intervention and disavowing these nations.

answers.description: Let’s pledge neutrality and hope that the powers of Europe can come to an agreement. This has always been the safe stance.
answers.feedback: It wouldn’t have hurt to have been more firm against Germany/Italy.

answers.description: I think the changes we've seen in the world, in terms of politics, have been based- cough -based upon a strong desire for change from the old capitalist system.
answers.feedback: Some of your supporters indeed look up to these new despots as a source of stability in a rapidly changing world. But people are concerned about their aggressive nature.

answers.description: We don’t plan to address foreign policy, except disavowing extremism wherever we meet it.
answers.feedback: Germany is very unpopular in the states, you could’ve done more to disavow them.

questions.description: As President, what will your policies on race and Civil Rights be?

answers.description: I fully support a civil rights bill. Although we freed the slaves almost a century ago, their children and grandchildren still live under oppression due to racist laws. One of my priorities is to help the disadvantaged among us.
answers.feedback: This is the expected response from a Republican.

answers.description: While I won't make race a part of my campaign, I will make subtle improvements, but in ways that won’t upset the South.
answers.feedback: Civil rights are not a big issue this election, so this is not a bad choice.

answers.description: Under no circumstances would I support the advance of civil rights.
answers.feedback: The era of Lily Whites are thought to be over. What you lose nationwide is not worth what you could gain in the south from this answer.

questions.description: What is your stance on trade?

answers.description: I support Tariff increases. We need to protect American businesses during times like these.
answers.feedback: A standard answer for a Republican. Tariffs are not exactly nationally popular, however.

answers.description: While I believe protectionism is important, I fear these tariffs are way too high and should be decreased.
answers.feedback: Promising to cut tariffs is a good idea, but many Republicans raise their eyebrows at this proposal.

answers.description: I’m glad the Smoot-Hawley Tariff Act was repealed, it was making the Depression worse. We need to open up markets for American businesses.
answers.feedback: Most voters were not happy with the economic situation caused by those tariffs.

answers.description: I’d say I am okay with trade, and support our current system.
answers.feedback: A response that will help you in some areas but hurt you in others.

questions.description: Let’s talk a bit about your own policies. Your 'Share Our Wealth' program includes a cap on personal fortunes at $100 Million USD, and an annual income cap at $1 Million USD. What are your thoughts on this?Let’s talk a bit about your own policies. Your 'Share Our Wealth' program includes a cap on personal fortunes at $100 Million USD, and an annual income cap at $1 Million USD. What are your thoughts on this?

answers.description: This is a horrible idea. During a depression, we should encourage spending.
answers.feedback: An expected attack.

answers.description: I think it's clearly too much. A cap on someone's personal fortune is clearly unconstitutional.
answers.feedback: This may be a good route to take.

answers.description: Frankly, these rates are a compromise, and I’ll set the rates even higher if I get more congressional support.
answers.feedback: Pledging to raise taxes farther is not a good idea, and this sort of talk is not what Republicans talk about.

answers.description: These rules are good, will give the government the funds to help the American people, and prevent the wealthy from becoming too powerful
answers.feedback: Although some progressives are happy, the idea of these taxes are widely unpopular.

questions.description: Earlier today, it was revealed to the press that a federal investigation into voter fraud during Huey Long's election in 1932 is underway. Do you have a response to this?

answers.description: We should let the facts play out. Senator Long has a right to innocence unless proven guilty.
answers.feedback: Your advisors feel you're not going on the offensive, but he will be hurt nonetheless.

answers.description: Huey Long's reign of dictatorial terror in Louisiana has finally caught up to him. We need a president who is scandal free.
answers.feedback: Hit him where it hurts.

questions.description: Do you plan on extensive personal campaigning in public?

answers.description: It's clear people think I am weak when giving public speeches, so I will prove them wrong.
answers.feedback: You are generally thought to be a weak public speaker.

answers.description: It's clear people think I am weak when giving public speeches, so I will prove them wrong.
answers.feedback: You are generally thought to be a very good and captivating public speaker, which will help you in the polls.

answers.description: It's clear people think I am weak when giving public speeches, so I will prove them wrong.
answers.feedback: This ends up doing little in the polls.

answers.description: It's clear people think I am weak when giving public speeches. I think we should leave it up to the surrogates.
answers.feedback: Your advisors believe you're missing an opportunity here.

questions.description: Considering the current rate of deflation of the American dollar, would you consider leaving the gold standard as president?

answers.description: Yes, I believe that abolishing the federal gold standard will help to solve our current deflation problem.
answers.feedback: This will help you a bit among the Progressives in the party.

answers.description: No, the gold standard is an important backing of our currency. There are better ways to deal with our deflation problem.

questions.description: What are your thoughts on the United States Supreme Court? There are some rumors going around about scrapped plans by the Roosevelt administration to pack and reform the courts, it’s become a more notable topic.

answers.description: Y’know, I think we could certainly add term limits. While I don’t agree with the whole plan, I think Roosevelt had a point.
answers.feedback: Even some Democrats oppose the leaked plan, along with all of Republicans. This is an unexpected stance that will hurt you a bit. Supreme Court reform isn’t unpopular, but this plan sure is.

answers.description: I believe the Supreme Court deserves our utmost respect, and plans to pack it for partisan means it unacceptable.
answers.feedback: This is the expected answer.

questions.description: Foreign Policy is growing ever more important in the long run with what's going on in Europe. However, in general, what would a Long Administration’s foreign policy look like?

answers.description: We’re mostly gonna keep Roosevelt's current policies. Maybe a bit less intervention.
answers.feedback: Foreign policy is not really a big issue this election. No harm, no foul.

answers.description: We need to be more involved on the world stage to ensure peace. Perhaps joining the League of Nations is a good idea.
answers.feedback: This position is booed across the Republican spectrum. Americans at large are more isolationist right now.

answers.description: Let’s not really address foreign policy, besides promising to keep our current vision of the Monroe Doctrine.
answers.feedback: This seems a touch too globalist for most voters, but it could help in some areas.

answers.description: Over the last few years, we were too entangled in foreign affairs. Foreign aid was crippling our debt and we are guided by Wall Street and Standard Oil in our foreign decision making.
answers.feedback: This is probably the majority view right now. Americans want to focus on America First and aren’t interested in occupying nations in Central America.

questions.description: Looks like another scandal broke out. The New York Times is reporting that as Governor, Huey Long essentially kidnapped a man named Sam Irby who was prepared to speak out against his administration during his Senate campaign. Any thoughts?

answers.description: We will sit back and watch his campaign fall apart.
answers.feedback: Some pundits wonder if this is the end of his campaign.

answers.description: I will join in calling Senator Long to resign and drop out.
answers.feedback: Some pundits wonder if this is the end of his campaign, although your attempts to add on don't really stick.

questions.description: Yet again, another scandal seems to have shown up. The Chicago Daily Tribune catches a detailed scoop on Huey Long's use of state jobs to maintain his political power, and compare it to Tammany Hall in New York. How will your campaign respond to this?

answers.description: Write to any paper willing to talk with us - this is disqualifying.
answers.feedback: A strong response, and Long will nevertheless be damaged by this.

answers.description: We will ignore the press and continue the campaign as usual. Anything we may say could easily backfire.
answers.feedback: This is a safe strategy.

questions.description: Do you support granting independence to the Philippines? What about other United States colonies?

answers.description: It's quite hypocritical for a state founded on independence from a faraway power to continue to possess colonies. I believe the Philippines, along with Alaska and Hawaii deserve their independence.
answers.feedback: Interesting response, although many voters think that independence should be granted after the global stage calms down.

answers.description: I am very glad to hear that we are on track to grant the Philippines their independence within the next 20 years. If we can shorten the timeline, I would support that.
answers.feedback: Americans generally support letting the Philippines determine their own - as of late.

answers.description: It's dangerous to give up such important strategic areas in a more hostile world. I think we should hold onto them until there is a more peaceful situation.
answers.feedback: A fair point is to be made here.

questions.description: Yet again, another scandal of yours has hit the papers. The New York Herald Tribune reports that you told George Sokolsky that you're '...Mussolini and Hitler rolled into one. Mussolini force-fed dissidents castor oil; I’ll give them Tabasco, and then they’ll like Louisiana.' Do you have any response?

answers.description: It's insane he was even allowed to run. We do not support dictators, even if we aren't jumping onto the world stage.
answers.feedback: Long continues to dip in the polls.

answers.description: On a certain level, you have to respect how quickly these countries have rebuilt their strength. Obviously, we need to have proper democracy, but there's nothing wrong with a strong leader.
answers.feedback: Your advisors are scratching their heads here... what?

questions.description: What is your current policy towards farmers and subsidies?

answers.description: Subsidies have seemed to make the situation worse. Removing these regulations will allow the market to improve.
answers.feedback: Farmers are not really happy about this statement.

answers.description: Our current subsidies are important for helping farmers across the nation. They’re the ones that feed everyone here, and we ought to help them.
answers.feedback: This is the kind of answer that many in the west want to hear.

answers.description: We intend on keeping the subsidies, but we shall keep quiet about it to not alienate conservatives.
answers.feedback: A safe move, but it doesn't do much to change the polling.

questions.description: Seriously? The New York Times reported earlier today that you've been co-owning a oil company, called Win or Lose Oil Company, and using your position as Governor to grant them land rights. How will you respond?

answers.description: This is a new low - even for him.
answers.feedback: It's pretty clear he did exactly what the paper alleged. While not illegal, his populist image is seriously damaged.

questions.description: Another day, another rally. What are you looking to address today?

answers.description: I will promise voters that I am not the same kind of Republican like Hoover. I will keep most of the New Deal and protect us from the radical policies of Huey Long.
answers.feedback: A perfect response.

answers.description: Let’s keep a positive campaign, no more attacks. I believe the American People are tired of them.
answers.feedback: This answer is safely moderate.

answers.description: Huey Long is a nutcase, who cannot be trusted with any sort of power.
answers.feedback: Long retaliates these attacks as the race seems to be escalating.

questions.description: Election Day is tomorrow. Any last things you wish to focus on?

answers.description: No, I trust that Americans will see who the better candidate is. Any last minute statements could backfire on us, which is the last thing we need.
answers.feedback: This is a safe strategy if you have built up a good lead.

answers.description: We will stop Huey Long at all costs and bring America forward.
answers.feedback: This is an expected topic for a final speech.

answers.description: I will give a very general speech that addresses how I plan to preserve the New Deal.
answers.feedback: Alright. Way to get that crowd fired up.

answers.description: Our last effort will be an attack on Huey Long. He’s a fascist demagogue.
answers.feedback: A good way to further dent his popularity.

questions.description: Where will you spend the final day of your campaign?

answers.description: Illinois, with some time in Iowa too. These are crucial states we must hold.
answers.feedback: Best of luck tomorrow.

answers.description: New York is a heavy prize in the Electoral College. We can’t afford to let Alf Landon pick up those 47 Electoral Votes.
answers.feedback: Best of luck tomorrow.

answers.description: I will hold rallies in Pennsylvania and New Jersey. I bet I could win Pennsylvania, which Roosevelt was unable to do.
answers.feedback: Best of luck tomorrow.

answers.description: The midwest is a crucial area. I will make spend the day making stops in Ohio, Michigan, and Indiana.
answers.feedback: Best of luck tomorrow.

scenarioDescription:
After four years of Roosevelt and his New Deal plan, a second term seemed all but certain - until he died. A tense and chaotic Democratic Convention nominated Huey Long on the 30th ballot. Meanwhile, the Republican Party, still reeling from brutal losses in 1932 and 1934, have backed Alf Landon, a moderate Republican governor of Kansas.

Senator Long must unite the New Deal Coalition to defeat Landon. Alf Landon may have to win the support of some of the Democratic Establishment under a “Anyone but Huey Long” coalition.
